#wayfairwednesday When it's so pretty that it physically hurts to look, at you know you're doing something right.

What day is it? #moarmortyday #mortytuesday

I get the coolest bass commissions. The next generation (gen 4?) wenge Wayfairs are starting to take shape. There's 3 in this batch, this is the first that's in a photogenic state. Also first 2x2 headstock! I'm always happy to do them, they just don't get ordered so much. Something about tuning stability üòâ

Another shot from Thursdays late night jam at the workshop through the new 40Moar from @onkelamplified I'm shipping the Morty in this photo to its new owner in Dublin on Tuesday, after giving it a fresh polish, set up and set of strings. But the Wayfair is still available if anyone is interested! I love having it in the workshop, but would love it more to have it in a players hands!

It's going to be very hard to know which of these two to plug in first. Walnut body and neck with ebony board and a set of vintage wound firebird style mini hbs OR a mahogany body and neck with wenge fretboard, 2 P90s and a jazzmaster trem.. #firstworldproblems

I'm thinking of starting up a second Instagram profile just for photos of my neck joints. Walnut Wayfair with comfortable upper fret access ‚ù§Ô∏è

It was light outside my workshop when I sat down to play. Next thing I know it's past midnight, dark outside and I didn't get a chance to take a photo in natural light. This amp is really something special. My guitars haven't ever sounded this good, I don't think I have ever sounded this good, and it feels so easy. It's feels like there isn't anything between my fingers and the speakers. There's no sag, or compression, the amp just eats it up. The sounds right there. It's kinda hard to explain.. It feels really liberating to have no reverb, drive, mod, delay, only one eq control and just have the pure, untampered tone of the guitar, and how it's being played. Got some nice cab mics on the way, so I can make demos. In other news this was one of the last times I will get to play this hollow Morty as its now sold. It will be spending the rest of it's days in Dublin. I'm very happy that it's getting a permanent new home!

My good friend @onkelamplified is giving away a beautiful custom pedal board. You would be a fool not to enter. Go check out his feed for how to take part!

It's Tuesday today so here's a Morty ‚ù§Ô∏è In just a few weeks I'll be able to lay out a post of at least 12 naked Mortys. That will be an epic post.

Please excuse the smudge marks on the trem. It's hard not to touch this one.. 1.8kgs or 3.9lbs so far. Just needs tuners, pots, pup selector switch, strap pins, strings. ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§ü§§

Moar neck joint heaven.

This bass Wayfair build has been stuck on hiatus for about 3 months, whilst some gold left handed tuners that I ordered have been sent to just about everywhere BUT my workshop. Watching the tracking was bizarre, 6 different US cities, Japan, Holland, then Copenhagen. They finally arrived today, so I can wrap up this build! Cant wait for @thefuzzyjello to get his hands on it!

Well @onkelamplified has completed the 40Moar and UPS is shipping it from his workshop in Gibsonville to my workshop in Copenhagen. Seems almost a shame to seperate it from the Moar Offset he's got, but I'm sure he has some other amazing amps to play it through! I can't wait to get my hands on it, and can't wait to see just how loud it is! By all reports anything more then about 4 is bordering on dangerous üòà If any of you are in the market for a custom amp, cab, pedal board or pedal get in touch with Mike ( @onkelamplified ). He's been such a pleasure to work with, and what he makes is truly unique, and he's always up for a challenge! (my amp started off as a 5 watt champ...)

Totally hollow ash P Bass build going through final QC steps these days. I like to leave an instrument strung up under tension for a few weeks after completion to give it time to settle and move around before shipping. Normally nothing needs adjusting, but it's better safe then sorry! It also gives me a chance to play them a little üòé

I don't talk politics or religion here on Instagram. Life's too short and it's not professional, but if this post offends you then frankly I don't want you playing on one of my instruments. Your political view is a choice, as is your religious faith. But getting murdered as a result of systematic oppression and discrimination, just for being born a certain way, is disgusting. #blacklivesmatter

Mondays ‚ù§Ô∏è Today was spent adding brass side dots to a bunch of necks, doing a stage 1 fretjob on 2 necks, glueing up a few necks to bodies, carving a bubinga neck and eating couscous.

Crazy natural light comes into my workshop in the early evening. Very excited to get this build moving again after a brief pause due to a truss rod shortage in Europe (corona stopping deliveries from China) but I found a supplier with a small batch and snatched them all up so was able to get this neck built, and get the guitar to the next stage.

How would you order yours?

This one's gonna be quite a clean build. Walnut Wayfair with a set of firebird mini humbuckers. Can't wait to put on its first layer of oil!

I'm quietly keeping hold of this stock build from January, not posting it officially for sale anywhere. My order book is keeping my hands full, and it's growing steadily longer, so I doubt I'll be able to make another stock Wayfair until maybe a year from now... So just saying. If you want a Wayfair, and don't want to wait a while, and like the look of this one, it's kinda for sale.

These guitars aren't actually that thin. They just have big arm and belly cuts, giving a very thin profile on the upper side of the body. They are around 45mm (so around 1.7") thick at the centre of the body, so they still have a very good acoustic tone. I A/B'd some Wayfairs again 330s and interestingly mine were quite a lot louder (acoustically). I put a lot of effort into making my Wayfairs as resonant as possible. Also #camoflauge

Had a very cool visit today from fellow Copenhagen local, Archelaos. He's the man behind @bluefxdevices and promised to bring along a few pedals for me to try. He arrived by bicycle (as is the norm here in Copenhagen) but had a breadboard of an oscillating fuzz pedal in his front bike rack. How authentic and cool is that!?! Anyway he left me one of his Nebula drive pedals to put on my new workshop board. It sounds great, very fat and round with a smooth high end, even at high gain settings. It also adds very little hum to the signal which is nice. Looking forward to testing it lots moar.

#mortymonday Spent most of today dealing with admin, sharpening an old fretsaw and glueing up necks. I did however get a chance to plug this guy in for a few minutes. Those were a few very loud and very good minutes.

Wayfair with a JM vibrato? Why the hell not! @johnhayn_es proving himself to be one of the coolest customers by commissioning this, one of the coolest Web designers (he's the man behind moarguitars.com), and one of the coolest guys I've encountered on this whole guitar building journey. #moarguitarsforever #moarwayfair

A nice tidy bench top for binding the walnut Wayfair today. It really helps to cut 10 / 15 strips of binding tape before starting this job. You can (almost never) have too much!

It's becoming a nice part of the weekly schedule filming this. I talk alot about tooling, Wayfairs and truss rod shortages. It's great. Link to YouTube video in bio.

ALL NAKED MORTYS SOLD! Got another fantastic delivery from @guitarsandwoods today. They sell the things I need to make the guitars you want ‚ù§Ô∏è

What's better then two P90s? . . . . Moar P90s #dadjokes

WOW I've been overwhelmed by the interest in the "stripped down" Mortys! So to clarify a few details, on this first batch I'm letting you choose pickup location, from neck, middle, or bridge, but I am only offering a single P90, with single volume. These aren't full on custom guitars, if you want that, you're welcome to order one of my regular, finished Mortys! Fretboard radius will be 12" and nut width is 42mm. Stainless steel medium jumbo frets. To reserve a guitar I need 150usd / 150eur / 150gbp as a deposit. Expected waiting time is around 8 to 10 weeks. The deposit will be taken from the 850usd / 700gbp / 810eur bill. You can select body woods from Ash and mahogany, neck woods from maple or mahogany and either rosewood or ebony for the fretboard. Prices do not include Vat. If you are within the EU I will (unfortunately) need go charge it, and shipping will be extra too. I've sold 6 of the 10 I'm limiting this batch to in the past 4 hours.

Currently working on two moar of these from my order book. I'm in two minds if I would prefer this set up on my own personal guitar, or the tele bridge with a P90 neck. What do you think? #moarmortyday

Looks good enough to eat! I'm putting f hole binding on a Wayfair that I'm working on over the next few days, looking forward to tackling that incredibly fiddly task again! #moarguitars #moarmorty

One thing that I think separates guitars made in small workshops like mine, to factory made guitars are details like this. When I'm looking at a piece of wood that I have selected to use for a body, assessing where to cut and carve, I'm always thinking ahead about what kind of grain pattern I want to emphasise, what grain I have to work with, and where I want to place it on the body. I don't just slap a piece of wood into a cnc machine and press play. (although I do have a cnc machine and for some things they are absolutely fantastic!) It makes my belly cuts quite sexy. #moarmorty

Love an unbound Wayfair.

The wenge Wayfair family continues to grow. 5 of my current commissions are inspired by this build. I can kinda see why! What's hard to put across with photos, and even video, is the feel of a wenge hollowbody. There's a tightness to it, with an open, dry sound. Very special ‚ù§Ô∏è #moarguitars #moarwayfair

Just needs a volume pot and strings. 3kgs / 6.6lbs in weight currently, and this is with an Ash body, maple neck and bubinga fretboard. I'm very happy with how it feels in the hands. #pbassfromheaven

By all reports this one is settling in beautifully at its new home in Indonesia with @limasenar . Huge temperature and humidity shifts are always a bit of a concern when shipping guitars so, as Ziva suggested, I put carbon support rods inside this neck, and it's rediculously stiff, like really stupidly stiff. The guitar has a very tight feel and sound to it actually, I wonder if the carbon rods have something to do with it?

This is going to be quite a nice build. One piece mahogany set neck S type, with a bubinga neck and wenge fretboard (with compound radius) firebird style pickups, 3 way toggle and universal volume and tone controls. Gonna rip.

Did you know that all my guitars and basses come with stainless steel frets as standard, included in the base price? It's a great feeling to know that every instrument leaving my workshop will always have perfect frets, even after years worth of hard playing!

OK so who wants one of these? #moarwayfair

I realised that lately I've been posting quite finished looking guitars, and less about the process. To be honest it's a bit scary, and makes me feel a bit vulnerable, showing what happens behind the scenes of a workshop. There's always mistakes, stuff to sand out, problems to solve, and mess. Lots of mess. So I thought I should face my fears by showing one of these mistakes (or rather "design through process" ) on this hollow P bass I'm currently working on. I like deep arm cuts on all my instruments, so I gave this guy the same treatment, but oh snap, I accidentally carved into the position where the bridge is going. So one of my apprentices spent today carving a piece of bubinga (to match the fretboard) to act as a spacer between the curved body and the bridge. We will come up with a nice shape for it tomorrow to turn it into a design feature. It'll probably end up being the thing that I like the most about this build. It's often the f*~kups that end up being a projects best feature!

I haven't been able to ship this guitar since completeting it a month or so ago, as its owner has been traveling, and then this corona thing happened (shipping is back to normal now though!) So rather then just let the guitar collect dust I've been adding layers oil most days, to pull abit more out of the grain, and frankly I think it's starting to look rediculous.

Video of this guy in action in my bio. The unique combination of P90 and passive piezo sounds absolutely incredible, check it out for yourself!

Making a bone nut. #moarguitars

I'm not quite at the final level of finish on this, hence the smudges and small lines on the body left over from earlier oil layers that I'll buff out before the final layer. But this guitar is looking so good. I think this might be one of my best oil finishes yet. #wenge #moarguitars

I'm a big fan of walnut these days. Very excited to have a few commissions with it coming in the following months. It's a lovely wood.

To quote the person in my workshop today, listening to me test playing this; "wow man, that's EXACTLY what a guitar should sound like" With just one vintage scatterwound P90 on the bridge side of centre. It's very hard to find a bad sound in this guitar. Sometimes you're limitations are what make you fantastic ‚ù§Ô∏è

I know I posted this same guitar yesterday, but my god this thing plays well, so I decided it deserved a second day in the limelight. I don't often get time (or maybe I don't often give myself time) to pause and enjoy when I'm testing a guitar, as I'm mainly just scrutinising for things that could be that 1% better, but I lost track of time playing on this one.. My love affair with P90s grows ever deeper. #teletuesday

I've gotten quite a few orders for walnut guitars over the past few weeks, and I think this guitar is the culprit! It's a really really cool wood. Dense, light and hard with beautiful grain and colour (that's what she said...) This guitar is about to go to its new owner in the states, will be exciting to see how it progresses..

A couple of Wayfair foetuses caught in the wild. Lots and lots and lots and lots and lots of sanding, carving and refining left to do... #moarwayfair #moarguitars #hollowbodyguitar #archtopguitar #fholes #carvedtopguitar #hollowbodybass

Did you guys know that I wind all my own pickups? This gives me the flexibility to do more or less anything for each individual order, and each pickup is wound specifically for each customer (I don't have a massive stash of P90s) I wind each one with a specific player, guitar and tone in mind They also sound really really good. #pickupwinding #handwoundpickups #goldfoilpickups #boutiquepickups #guitartone

Right then guys! I think I've made enough of these, and they are different enough from the original, to warrant their own name, like my Wayfair, I need a name for my hollow or solid T's. This week's workshop diary is up on YouTube! Click the link in my bio, or swipe up on my story to see what I've been up to this week.

I know I'm maybe a little biased but I really love this guitar. Modern playability with a natural feel, and a resonant, vibrant and warm sound that works with what you give it.

Left or right and why? I'm a bit torn. I love them both, for different reasons. It's amazing how different these two guitars are actually, when coming from such similar places, and sharing the same lines.
